Key Match Events: Lucas Erceg and Vinnie Pasquantino were injured on one play in the 8th inning
Zach Dezenzo worked a walk to bring in the go-ahead run, and Mauricio Dubón knocked a two-run single through the left side to pad the Astros' lead
Post-Match Reflections: Royals manager Matt Quatraro said that Erceg was in pain when he touched his fingers, so there wasn’t a need for a conversation because he knew he wasn’t going to be able to throw another pitch
Quatraro also said that they trust John Schreiber and got the ground ball, but it’s hit too slowly to get the double play
Schreiber said that he came into a tough situation and was trying to execute his pitches, but didn’t execute against Dezenzo
Singer said that he felt good and like the sinker had a lot of movement, and the slider was the pitch tonight that worked well
Miscellaneous Highlights: Brady Singer pitched six strong innings and yielded two runs on five hits with six strikeouts
Kyle Isbel gave the Royals a 3-2 lead in the seventh with a three-run double into the left-field corner off Bryan Abreu
The Royals didn’t have many scoring opportunities against Houston starter Hunter Brown
Others: Pasquantino has been ruled out for six to eight weeks with a broken right thumb
Erceg has been a solid leverage pitcher for the Royals since being acquired at the Trade Deadline
